intro: Coccinia gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon cucumber, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, melons, and squash. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow when mature. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its vines can grow up to several meters in length. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of food in local communities.
